page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content: Our area has four distinct regions each with shops, a church, school, and public houses.It is a pleasant place to live because it is surrounded by farmland and woods, yet is close to London and the coast. The older houses have large gardens and the housing estates are well set out, with open spaces and trees. The council owned properties were built after the second world war for families from London. The nearest railway is Billericay with frequent fast services to Liverpool Street and Southend and conections to East Anglia. The M.25 is twenty minutes drive away. Most people work outside the area. Primary school children find plenty to do, with scouting organisations, sports clubs and fields and woods to play in. Teenagers complain, that there is nothing to do but visit pubs.
